text: I find myself cursing them more often
than not I'm sure religion and Faith had
important roles to play in human history
uh in my view at present uh they are far
more destructive than constructive now I
say this um with a bit of trepidation
because religion means many many things
certainly some aspects of religion are
things we would all applaud the idea
that we have a moral code that we try to
live by but I don't think that's what
you mean by religion religion by
religion we usually mean deism we mean
belief in something we absolutely can't
see for which there's no evidence to me
this Cuts against the grain of what it
means to be a scientist I don't think
people should not believe in God but it
seems to me to have a very strong belief
in that for which there is absolutely
not one shred of evidence goes against
the very meaning of of of of r
nationalism well certainly science and
religion are the two big ones that come
to mind and I think unfortunately
pulling us in opposite directions I mean
for me the large story that has been
playing out for several centuries and
that continues to play out today on the
world stage is the battle between the
rational and the irrational for me
science represents one of these religion
I'm afraid represents the other so I
think it would be hard to tell the story
of human uh ization without talking
about science and religion very easy to
tell most of the story by talking only
about these two things certainly signal
events in both science and religion as a
scientist one can point to Darwin one
can point to Einstein I don't think
single events are what either of these
forces are about I think these these two
things are ways of thinking it's not
about the discoveries that science has
produced because as I always tell my
students half of what I'm going to teach
you today is wrong I just don't know
which Happ yet you know science is about
constantly revising our beliefs so I
wouldn't point to single discoveries and
say wasn't this important what science
really has to teach us is a way of
knowing it's a way of finding out what
the truth is about the world uh science
is not infallible but it's as close as
we can get you know Winston Churchill I
believe it was who said um democracy is
the worst form of government except for
all the others well science is the worst
way of knowing except for all the other
ways of
knowing
